cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.trajectory: moving rapidly west-northwest across the eastern Caribbean toward Hispaniola, Jamaica, eastern Cuba, then curving toward the Florida peninsula/Gulf coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern or central Cuba (first significant landfall)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings presently limited to Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & the Grenadines, Grenada, southern Dominican Republic, Haiti and Jamaica – none for Florida yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & the Grenadines; Tropical-storm warnings for Martinique, southern Dominican Republic and all of Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands, southern Leeward Islands, southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida Keys and Florida peninsula (including the east coast) during the 5-day period
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (39–57 mph) are possible beginning late Tuesday, peaking Wednesday morning as Elsa passes west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (1–2 ft) and high surf/rip currents possible along the Atlantic shoreline; surge above 3 ft is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts over Palm Beach County, producing brief urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and intermittent port-channel closures may be required during highest winds/seas.
